item.title: Today we join many other area Fire, EMS, Police and 911 agen
item.description:
Today we join many other area Fire, EMS, Police and 911 agencies in support of Past Mineral County Sheriff and current Berkeley County Career Firefighter Jeremy Taylor with is battle with cancer Morgan County Emergency Communications is#taylorstrong Today we join many other area Fire, EMS, Police and 911 agencies in support of Past Mineral County Sheriff and current Berkeley County Career Firefighter Jeremy Taylor with is battle with cancer
Morgan County Emergency Communications is #taylorstrong

item.title: The National Weather Service has issued a Flood Watch today,
item.description:
The National Weather Service has issued a Flood Watch today, Thursday, August 29 from 3 p.m. to midnight in our region due to heavy rainfall expected during the evening hours. A possible two to four inches of rain in a short period of time could pose flash flooding risks in low-lying areas and along waterways. The public is asked to monitor the weather and be aware of risks in flood-prone areas.https://forecast.weather.gov/showsigwx.php?warnzone=WVZ051&warncounty=WVC065&firewxzone=WVZ051&local_place1=Berkeley%20Springs%20WV&product1=Flood+Watch&lat=39.5561&lon=-78.2181 The National Weather Service has issued a Flood Watch today, Thursday, August 29 from 3 p.m. to midnight in our region due to heavy rainfall expected during the evening hours. A possible two to four inches of rain in a short period of time could pose flash flooding risks in low-lying areas and along waterways. The public is asked to monitor the weather and be aware of risks in flood-prone areas.
